body_html: as a datapoint, I'm able to pip install packages on Linux and bazel test sees them (action_env is only needed on MacOS for me). Note that Python can throw ImportError: for reasons unrelated to Python path, for instance, when it loads a binary extension in the process of import and this binary extension can't find something. Sometimes you can diagnose this by strace. IE, you can rule out PYTHONPATH being the problem by doing something like strace -Ttf -e -yy trace=open ... and checking if it actually looks inside PYTHONPATH dirs

body: as a datapoint, I'm able to `pip install` packages on Linux and `bazel test` sees them (`action_env` is only needed on MacOS for me). Note that Python can throw `ImportError:` for reasons unrelated to Python path, for instance, when it loads a binary extension in the process of import and this binary extension can't find something. Sometimes you can diagnose this by `strace`. IE, you can rule out `PYTHONPATH` being the problem by doing something like `strace -Ttf -e -yy trace=open ...` and checking if it actually looks inside `PYTHONPATH` dirs
